title: Alternative to Brush Script
content:
A client has suggested Brush Script as a potential typeface for a word on their album cover. They are going for fun, and a bit retro. Any suggestions to an alternative to this face?

Thanks.
author: vwcruisn

comments.content: [http://www.houseindustries.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018040340/http:/www.houseindustries.com/ "http://www.houseindustries.com") House Industries [[http://www.houseindustries.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018040340/http:/www.houseindustries.com/ "http://www.houseindustries.com") ] has a great selection of interesting retro brush faces that aren't as ubiquitous as Brush Script.

[Sign DNA](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018040340/http:/www.signdna.com/v2/cart/category.php?gp=32&id=35)

Too bad they don't offer any testing capabilities...

It your going for something with the same feeling as Brushscript but with a little more flair, try Vitrina from cubanica.
